page.title: 13THE VILLAGE POLICEMAN
page.content: PC Sharp came to Geddington 11 years ago after spending over 3 years in Kettering as a Beat Policeman. He enjoys the community involvement and wouldn't relish working in a town again. The work is sometimes tiring but the village is very quiet and incidents are few. His area of responsibility stretches from Pipewell in the Northwest to Cranford in the Southeast. His shiftwork is flexible to account for local activities such as evening Parish Council meetings or school cycling proficiency testing. Road accidents are his greatest source of distress and he regards the A43 as a most dangerous road. He maintains that village policeman are as generously equipped as their town counterparts.
